roadmaps.roadmap:
🎯 **LEARNING ROADMAP: PYTHON**
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

👤 **Current Level:** Beginner
⏰ **Estimated Timeline:** 3-6 months (with consistent practice)

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

## 📚 PHASE 1: FOUNDATIONS (Weeks 1-4)

**Goals:**
├─ Understand basic concepts and terminology
├─ Build foundational knowledge
└─ Complete first small project

**Learning Path:**
1️⃣ **Week 1-2:** Core Concepts
   • Learn fundamental principles
   • Watch intro tutorials (YouTube/Coursera)
   • Read beginner guides
   • Practice 30 min daily

2️⃣ **Week 3-4:** Hands-On Practice
   • Complete 3-5 small exercises
   • Join online communities (Reddit, Discord)
   • Build first mini-project
   • Document your learning

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

## 🚀 PHASE 2: SKILL BUILDING (Weeks 5-12)

**Goals:**
├─ Master intermediate techniques
├─ Build portfolio projects
└─ Learn best practices

**Learning Path:**
3️⃣ **Week 5-8:** Intermediate Skills
   • Deep dive into advanced topics
   • Take online course (Udemy/Coursera)
   • Practice daily (1 hour minimum)
   • Read documentation regularly

4️⃣ **Week 9-12:** Project Development
   • Build 2-3 portfolio projects
   • Contribute to open source (if applicable)
   • Get feedback from community
   • Refine your skills

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

## 🎓 PHASE 3: MASTERY (Weeks 13-24)

**Goals:**
├─ Achieve professional proficiency
├─ Specialize in specific area
└─ Teach/mentor others

**Learning Path:**
5️⃣ **Week 13-18:** Advanced Topics
   • Study advanced techniques
   • Build complex projects
   • Network with professionals
   • Attend workshops/webinars

6️⃣ **Week 19-24:** Specialization
   • Choose your niche
   • Build significant portfolio piece
   • Start freelancing/applying (if applicable)
   • Share knowledge (blog, YouTube)

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

## 📖 RECOMMENDED RESOURCES:

**Free Resources:**
• YouTube channels (search: "Python tutorial")
• Official documentation
• Free online courses (Coursera, edX)
• Community forums (Reddit r/learnPython)

**Paid Resources (Optional):**
• Udemy courses ($10-50)
• Books on Amazon
• Bootcamps (intensive learning)
• 1-on-1 mentoring

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

## 🎯 DAILY PRACTICE SCHEDULE:

**Beginner:** 30-60 minutes/day
**Intermediate:** 1-2 hours/day
**Advanced:** 2-4 hours/day

**Weekly Goals:**
├─ Monday-Friday: Focused learning (1 hour)
├─ Saturday: Project work (2-3 hours)
└─ Sunday: Review & planning (1 hour)

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

## 📊 PROGRESS TRACKING:

**Milestones:**
□ Complete Phase 1 (Foundation)
□ Build first project
□ Complete Phase 2 (Intermediate)
□ Build portfolio (3+ projects)
□ Complete Phase 3 (Advanced)
□ Share knowledge/teach others

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

## 💡 PRO TIPS:

✅ **Consistency over intensity** - Daily practice beats weekend cramming
✅ **Build projects** - Learning by doing is most effective
✅ **Join communities** - Learn from others, ask questions
✅ **Document progress** - Keep a learning journal
✅ **Teach others** - Best way to solidify knowledge
✅ **Stay curious** - Explore related topics

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

🎉 **Remember:** Everyone starts as a beginner. Your only competition is yesterday's version of yourself!

💾 **Next Step:** Choose ONE resource from Phase 1 and start TODAY!

🎯 **LEARNING ROADMAP: MACHINE LEARNING**
